bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The libreofficekit-devel package is missing headers for libraries and applications to use to utilize the libreofficekit library.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 5.1.5.1-2.fc24
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install libreofficekit-devel 2. Check for the existence of /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit and headers in the directory.
Actual results: The directory /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit doesn't exist, and obviously the headers don't either.
I believe these are the header files that should be there, though there may be more: /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit/LibreOfficeKit.h /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit/LibreOfficeKit.hxx /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit/LibreOfficeKitEnums.h /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit/LibreOfficeKitGtk.h /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit/LibreOfficeKitInit.h /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit/LibreOfficeKitTypes.h
Expected results: The directory /usr/include/LibreOfficeKit should exist and the headers should exist in there.
Additional info: This is required for building the LibreOffice Online software[1], specifically loolwsd[2].
[1]: https://github.com/LibreOffice/online [2]: https://github.com/LibreOffice/online/tree/master/loolwsd
libreoffice-5.2.1.2-2.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a0b855b6bc
libreoffice-5.1.5.2-5.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-a492d16149
